Articles.Content:
With a few structure panels, jet fuel canisters, and a LOT of super glue, Bill and the engineers finally found a way to refuel Jeb's flying machines.

- Plane (Docked) : http://prntscr.com/2fkc1u

- Plane (Undocked) : http://prntscr.com/2fkc6z

Decided to try and get a working refueling pad for a new base and this was the result, also getting the pad to the second landing strip was NOT an easy task though.

Note: having the panels sink under the surface wasn't intentional, but made it look that much cooler.

With a few structure panels, jet fuel canisters, and a LOT of super glue, Bill and the engineers finally found a way to refuel Jeb's flying machines.

- Plane (Docked) : http://prntscr.com/2fkc1u

- Plane (Undocked) : http://prntscr.com/2fkc6z

Decided to try and get a working refueling pad for a new base and this was the result, also getting the pad to the second landing strip was NOT an easy task though.

Note: having the panels sink under the surface wasn't intentional, but made it look that much cooler.

That is an elegant solution to the problem of how to refuel different aircrafts! I gave up and started using KAS, but I might reconsider... steel plates and fuel pipes, I presume?

And to think that I was using a down-facing docking port for base construction and hadn't come up with this...

Rune. Sometimes the simplest solutions are the most difficult to see.
I have been trying to make a decent looking one of these but they are all truck like vehicles, it never was very secsesful

hmmm. looks ingenious. Certainly far simpler than this monstrosity:

Oh that's an Arrinera by Mareczex333 on the left. Inigma finally sold enough shuttlecraft to be able to justify buying one for the company. The refueler is an SSI GR-2M. Great interior though:

Edited January 1, 2014 by inigma

DVGamesInc, i like this refueling pod design

Oh that's an Arrinera by Mareczex333 on the left.

Thanks for credits
